sub_title: Team Lead DNA laboratory | Sr (research) project manager | Molecular biological process engineer
summary:
AMBITION
Life Science is my passion, especially when I can contribute significantly to product and / or process innovations that have a clear positive impact on human life.
* Talent? Getting from research to implementation.
* Industry? Nowadays with ambition in the business of soil/crop health, after having served the animal industry. My drive is equally big in human research (i.e. healthcare/ sports).
* Approach? Clear project management, achieving goals by inspiring/ creation of team spirit.
* Businesses? Those that like me like to act decisively, whether in new research, and/ or in (industrial) processing.

PERSONAL CHARACTERISTICS
Top Sport mentality (don't quit to easily), dedicated, independent thinking, thoughtful decisive, organizer, precise, analytical, net-worker.

SKILLS
Project management, molecular and reproductive biology, various process technologies, (q)PCR, ISO, validation, QC, fertility, cryopreservation, genomics, life science, cloning, sequencing, DNA, flow cytometry/ FACS, imaging and separation techniques, applied statistics, 

...On a very different note, something I also did: Adventure Speaker/ Fundraiser....{YouTube]

ALS (Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis) is one of the most serious aggressive terminal muscle diseases. The average life expectancy after diagnosis is 3 years. Little is known what causes ALS. The foundation is there to raise awareness, initiate more research, and better quality of care for patients.

I raise funds for this foundation since 2007. First during my participation in the Tour d'Afrique, an extreme bicycle race of 95 stages across Africa (from Cairo to Cape Town). Substantial achieved improvements? See 'projects' below for a selection.

Key Responsibilities:
* directing project members, from academics/ bachelors (1-10) to field staff (300+)
* setting up and maintain partnerships/ networks (universities/ laboratories worldwide)
* processing/ separation techniques (development, optimization, validation, implementation including groundbreaking new technologies)
* quality control/ research (development, optimization, validation, implementation of new tests, such as: DNA damage, membrane intactness, binding assays using techniques like flow cytometry, microscopy, imaging)
* standardize laboratories worldwide
* support ISO certification (set up quality monitoring systems)
* data processing/ applied statistics
* setting up new project proposals and convert into project plans, analyses-interpretation of results,  intermediate and final reports
* (scientific) publishing, presentation, meeting techniques
* preparing yearly plans and vision documents
* contract negotiations
* grant/ patent applications, IP', 'title': 'Senior research project manager', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 63753, 'name': 'KeyGene (molecular plant breeding biotech company)', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQGK-1VXYkP2WA/company-logo_400_400/0/1519857024168?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=JXa6sFXy6yyxEHUsPXKat9NacUC76dk80xAnn0nuM-M', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/keygene/', 'employees': {'start': 51, 'end': 200}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 1995}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2000}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Wageningen', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 1995}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2000}}, 'company': 'KeyGene', 'description': 'As Researcher the first 2,5y i.a. responsible for implementation and further optimization of the so-called BAC (bacterial artificial chromosome) technology, to facilitate the isolaton of interesting genes from crops. I was the first who introduced this new technique in Europe from the U.S., which has led to the isolation of important disease resistance genes from eg barley, lettuce and tomato.

As Project Manager the last 2,5y responsible for four molecular biological research projects (budget > 9000 hours) regarding disease resistance genes in plants, which led to a variety of publications, and patent applications. 

Key Responsibilities:
* directing project teams (1-10 members)
* analysis-interpretation of research results/ writing (progress)reports for stakeholders
* (scientific) publishing/ presenting
* support patent applications (one accepted)', 'title': 'Researcher | Research project manager', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 2842, 'name': 'UC Davis (dept. Vegetable Crops)', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQEBG25KNBwuCQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1616103040374?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=VhoayHHbfQ7_XT-VGTDCVJ8CrDj9zfGllgAHy6RpZcs', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/uc-davis/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 1994}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 1995}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Davis, California', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 1994}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 1995}}, 'company': 'University of California, Davis', 'description': 'First as a MSc student then as coworker, succesfully set up, executed and completed a significant research project in which the entire genome of lettuce was cloned for the first time as large DNA fragments in Escherichia coli, to enable the isolation of interesting disease resistance genes.
